content: This is a list of websites that are blocked in Singapore. These websites are mainly unlicensed gambling, pimping (known as vice related activities), copyright infringement/piracy, and for spreading falsehoods. Some websites may be blocked because they are suspected scam websites. Websites that are blocked in Singapore are easily circumvented by a [DNS](/wiki/DNS) change without the need to use a [VPN](/wiki/VPN). As of 2019, there were 202 vice-related websites blocked by Singaporean authorities. ## Table of blocked websites This list is incomplete; you can help by adding missing items. *(May 2021)*Site website"non-compliance" with a correction direction issued against a statement on its website[POFMA](/wiki/POFMA)November 2025 ## Media coverage On 1 March 2022, the Asia Video Industry Association's Coalition Against Piracy (CAP) announced that it had obtained a court order from the [Singapore High Court](/wiki/High_Court_of_Singapore) for the blocking of 30 illegal streaming sites and nearly 150 domain names associated with those sites. On 28 September 2022, CAP stated that it had obtained a further court order for the blocking of a total of 245 domain names which provided access to 30 illegal streaming sites. - [Internet censorship in Singapore](/wiki/Internet_censorship_in_Singapore)
title: List of websites blocked in Singapore
